Did you know that every time you support one of our fundraisers that you are helping to fund classroom parties, dances, special events, and also helping the principals purchase items for their schools? The WPTC gives money to every principal at the start of the school year. This is called their school needs fund. We try to give them $2,000 per year. The principals have used this money for various things over the years: new laminators, recess equipment, banners for the school, and so much more. This money has funded many things that may not have normally been in their budgets to purchase. YOUR generous donations have made this possible. This year, because of your generosity, we were able to give the district a $2,000 donation. Our treasurer, Tammy Flynn, presented Mr. Salemi with a check this week. This money will be used to purchase something to benefit the district as a whole. We thank all of our members and please continue to support our fundraisers and we can continue to support the schools.💰💯📓✏️ #supportthewptc #supportourschools 🙌

Westchester Educational Foundation published a note.
June 4, 2013 at 3:35 PM ·

Adopt a Class and See the Future!
Please consider giving a helping hand to classrooms in Westchester School District 92 ½.  Your $250 tax-deductible gift, specially designated to a classroom of your choice, will help provide classroom tools for grammar school students that might not otherwise be available.  Your donation will also impact the mission of the Westchester Educational Foundation (WEF) – to enhance the quality of education and provide District 92 ½ students in Westchester with expanded learning opportunities.

Each donor will be recognized during the 2013-14 school year with:
•  An invitation for you and a guest at a recognition reception at the beginning of the school year.•  The opportunity to visit your specific classroom and  students during the school year to see the impact of your gift.  Depending on the grade level, reading stories or career days are appropriate.  Or do you have an interest or hobby that you would like to share?  This is a great mentoring opportunity!
•  Donor recognition on the District 92 ½ website and the WEF Facebook page.

Classroom sections are limited.  We have a need for 28 donors at WPS, 19 at WIS, and 22 at WMS (including specialized classrooms such as art, music, and gym).  Room sponsorships are great opportunities for corporate, municipal leaders or departments, or parent donors.  Plus, individuals or families can consider pooling together for a sponsorship.  If you choose to sponsor a specific classroom (your child’s, for instance) preference will go in the order that gifts were received and you’ll be contacted once classroom assignments are announced.  Please mail the information below and your $250 check made payable to the Westchester Educational Foundation to:
Westchester Educational Foundation
10526 W. Cermak Road
Suite 101
Westchester, IL 60154

For questions, please call Fundraising Chair Eric Schmidt at (630) 207-4505.

post_text: We've been asked a question about how the adopt a classroom money is divided that makes sense to answer on Facebook. Half of your sponsorship goes directly to the classroom that you've directed your gift to. It helps our supporters get a better connection to the classroom. The other half of the sponsorship will stay with the Foundation to be granted for larger projects later in the school year. Since this is the first time our district has been supported by a dedicated not-for-profit organization, we don't know how much support to expect in our first year, but we plan to make a positive educational impact with your funds!
